title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — In a defensive slugfest that echoed the tenor of the era, the Chicago Bulls outlasted the Los Angeles Clippers 94-89 in a late-season battle. But the final score was a mere subplot to the historic, single-handed demolition performed by one man: Michael Jordan.

On a night where his supporting cast struggled, Jordan authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a staggering 49 points. He was a one-man offensive system, relentlessly attacking the rim and hitting from mid-range against a helpless Clippers defense. The 49-point explosion was not merely a high-volume night; it was an efficient masterpiece that accounted for over half of his team’s total output.

While Scottie Pippen contributed 12 points and Dennis Rodman cleaned the glass with 21 rebounds, this was the Jordan Show from start to finish. The Clippers, led by 22 points from Rodney Rogers, hung tough, but they had no answer for the game’s premier assassin. Every time Los Angeles threatened to close the gap, Jordan responded with a cold-blooded basket, silencing the road crowd and steadying his team.

This was more than a win; it was a statement. In a tight, physical contest, Jordan’s superhuman effort lifted the Bulls to victory almost entirely on his own shoulders. His 49 points weren’t just a number on a stat sheet; they were a testament to his relentless will and a stunning reminder of his singular greatness in what would be his final chapter with the dynasty Bulls.
